emergency.title: Crisis Support
emergency.subtitle: You are not alone. Help is available 24/7.
emergency.immediate_danger: If you are in immediate danger, call 911 or go to your nearest emergency room.

call_988.title: Call 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
call_988.description: Free and confidential support 24/7 for people in distress and their loved ones.

text_crisis.title: Crisis Text Line
text_crisis.description: Text with a trained crisis counselor 24/7 from anywhere in the US.

chat_online.title: Online Crisis Chat
chat_online.description: Chat online with a trained crisis counselor.

support.reach_out: It's okay to reach out for help.

safety_plan.title: Crisis Safety Plan
safety_plan.description: A personalized plan to help you stay safe during a crisis.

step1.title: Step 1: Warning Signs
step1.description: Recognize your personal warning signs that a crisis may be developing.
step1.examples: Examples: feeling hopeless, isolation, increased substance use, sleep changes

step2.title: Step 2: Internal Coping Strategies
step2.description: Things you can do on your own to help yourself feel better.
step2.examples: Examples: listen to music, take a walk, practice deep breathing, journal

step3.title: Step 3: Social Contacts for Distraction
step3.description: People and social settings that can help distract from the crisis.
step3.examples: Examples: friends, family members, social activities, support groups

step4.title: Step 4: Contacts for Help
step4.description: People you can ask for help during a crisis.
step4.examples: Examples: family members, friends, mental health professionals, crisis lines

step5.title: Step 5: Professional Contacts
step5.description: Mental health professionals and agencies to contact during a crisis.
step5.examples: Examples: therapist, psychiatrist, crisis center, emergency room

step6.title: Step 6: Making the Environment Safe
step6.description: Ways to remove or restrict access to lethal means.
step6.examples: Examples: remove firearms, medications, sharp objects; ask someone to keep them

step7.title: Step 7: Reasons for Living
step7.description: Things that are important to you and give your life meaning.
step7.examples: Examples: family, friends, pets, goals, spiritual beliefs, future plans

breathing.title: Deep Breathing
breathing.description: Slow, deep breathing can help calm your mind and body.
steps: Breathe in slowly through your nose for 4 counts
Breathe out slowly through your mouth for 6 counts

grounding.title: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding Technique
grounding.description: Use your senses to ground yourself in the present moment.

distraction.title: Healthy Distractions
activities: Call a friend or family member
Take a warm shower or bath

messages.crisis_detected: We're here for you. It sounds like you might be going through a difficult time.
messages.help_available: Professional help is available 24/7. You don't have to face this alone.
messages.safety_first: Your safety is our priority. Please consider reaching out for immediate help if you're in danger.
messages.not_therapist: Remember: This platform provides peer support, not professional therapy.
messages.emergency_services: If this is a medical emergency, please call 911 or go to your nearest emergency room.
messages.confidential_support: All crisis support conversations are confidential and secure.
messages.family_context: Consider involving trusted family members who can provide additional support.
messages.community_context: Your community and cultural supports can be valuable resources during this time.
messages.professional_context: Professional mental health services are available and recommended for ongoing support.
messages.low_risk_response: I understand you're going through a difficult time. Consider reaching out to friends, family, or a counselor who can provide support.
messages.moderate_risk_response: It sounds like you're experiencing significant distress. Please consider speaking with a mental health professional or calling a crisis helpline for support.
messages.high_risk_response: I'm very concerned about your wellbeing. Please reach out for immediate support from a crisis counselor, trusted friend, or family member.
messages.urgent_risk_response: This appears to be a mental health emergency. Please contact emergency services, a crisis hotline, or go to your nearest emergency room immediately.

dashboard.no_interventions_needed: No interventions needed at this time

test.enter_text_to_analyze: Enter text to analyze for crisis indicators...
